revised_title: Spectroscopic Investigations of Hydrogen Bonding Interactions in Gas Phase: Determination of Geometry and Potential Constants of Hydrogen-Bonded Heterodimer CH3CN \#x2022; HF
tldr: The authors investigated the hydrogen bonding interactions in the gas phase between methyl cyanide and hydrogen fluoride using microwave rotational spectroscopy. They determined the geometry and potential constants of the hydrogen-bonded heterodimer, providing insights into the molecular structure and properties of the dimer. This study contributes to the understanding of hydrogen bonding interactions in various chemical systems.
